item.description: As this is the first meeting, there is no book to be read. The idea is to gauge interest, what people have read, what they would like to read, etc. It's a chance to get to know one another, our literary and other backgrounds, and rehash all the wonderful excuses for why we never got around to reading the Iliad (my personal favourite: Didn't want to get beat up in high school for reading a book called "I laid Homer"). Try to have in mind a book or two you'd like to read - any time period or country is game. While many of us think Western Europe when speaking about the Classics, there's no reason that The Tale of Genji should be discarded.

group.name: Classic Books: Book Club for Die-hard Readers

item.name: First Meet-up
